meanings.definition: To discipline or punish in order to correct behavior.
meanings.sent1: The teacher chastened the student for talking in class.
meanings.sent2: Parents often chasten their children when they misbehave.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy learned a lesson after being chastened for chewing on the shoes.
meanings.sent4: The coach's strict training regimen chastened the team into shape.
meanings.sent5: The stern look from the principal was chastening enough to make the students quiet down.

meanings.definition: Serving as a warning or deterrent.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds were a chastening sign of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The high crime rate was a chastening reminder to always lock the doors.
meanings.sent3: The loud thunder was a chastening sound that made everyone stay indoors.
meanings.sent4: The steep cliffs served as a chastening barrier to the adventurous hikers.
meanings.sent5: The doctor's serious tone was a chastening indication of the severity of the illness.

meanings.definition: The act of disciplining or punishing.
meanings.sent1: The chastening of the student was necessary to maintain order in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, public shaming is used as a form of chastening.
meanings.sent3: The chastening of the unruly employee was done in front of the entire staff.
meanings.sent4: The chastening of the criminal was broadcasted on live television.
meanings.sent5: The public chastening of the politician was a spectacle that everyone talked about.
